intro: Erysimum majellense, commonly known as the rock wallaby bush, is a perennial flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Erysimum majellense is well adapted to harsh conditions and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
